message.content:
Search through all components in src/components/ for any mention of "LOOKSMAXXLABS", "LOOKSMAXX LABS", "Looksmaxx Labs", "LooksmaxxLabs" or similar variations.

Check headers, footers, navigation, modals, cards, and any UI components.

List all files and line numbers where these appear. This needs to be changed to "PROJECT CASSANOVA".

content.content:
1→# LOOKSMAXX Complete Taxonomy of Facial Measurements
     2→
     3→This document provides a comprehensive reference of all facial measurements, ratios, and scoring categories used by LOOKSMAXX and similar facial analysis systems.
     4→
     5→## Overview
     6→
     7→There are two main LOOKSMAXX services:
     8→
     9→1. **LOOKSMAXX** (looksmaxx-app.vercel.app / beta.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app) - 60+ facial ratios with percentile rankings
    10→2. **Premium Analysis** (Gumroad) - 47 cephalometric measurements with detailed reports
    11→
    12→Both use similar underlying measurement principles but differ in implementation.
    13→
    14→---
    15→
    16→## Primary Scoring Categories
    17→
    18→### Category Weights
    19→
    20→| Category | Weight | Description |
    21→|----------|--------|-------------|
    22→| **Harmony (HARM)** | 32-40% | Mathematical proportionality of facial features |
    23→| **Miscellaneous/Features (MISC)** | 25-26% | Individual feature quality and aesthetics |
    24→| **Angularity (ANGU)** | 15-22% | Facial leanness, definition, and 3D projection |
    25→| **Dimorphism (DIMO)** | 20% | Degree of masculine/feminine sexual dimorphism |
    26→
    27→---
    28→
    29→## 1. HARMONY SCORE (32-40% weight)
    30→
    31→**Definition:** Mathematical balance and proportionality of facial features relative to each other.
    32→
    33→### 1.1 Front Profile Harmony Measurements
    34→
    35→#### Facial Proportions
    36→
    37→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    38→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    39→| 1 | Facial Thirds | 29.5-36.5% each | Upper (hairline-brows), Middle (brows-nose), Lower (nose-chin) |
    40→| 2 | Lower Third Proportion | 30.6-34% | Chin to lower lip relative to nose to upper lip |
    41→| 3 | Total Face Height/Width | 1.3-1.4 | Total facial height divided by bizygomatic width |
    42→| 4 | FWHR | 1.9-2.06 | Bizygomatic width / upper lip to mid-brow height |
    43→| 5 | Total FWHR (tFWHR) | 1.33-1.38 | Bizygomatic width / hairline to chin |
    44→| 6 | Midface Ratio (MFR) | 0.93-1.01 | Upper lip height / IPD line distance |
    45→| 7 | Golden Ratio | 1.6 | Face length / face width |
    46→
    47→#### Width Relationships
    48→
    49→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    50→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    51→| 8 | Bigonial/Bizygomatic Width | 85.5-92% | Jaw width relative to cheekbone width |
    52→| 9 | Bitemporal Width | 84-95% | Temple width relative to cheekbone width |
    53→| 10 | Neck Width | 90-100% | Neck width relative to bigonial width |
    54→| 11 | Jaw Width | 0.9-1.0 | Bizygomatic / upper lip line |
    55→| 12 | Cheekbone High-Setedness | 81-100% | Cheekbone position relative to midface height |
    56→
    57→#### Eye Measurements
    58→
    59→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    60→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    61→| 13 | Eye Separation Ratio (ESR) | 44.3-47.4% | Pupil distance / bizygomatic width |
    62→| 14 | Eye Spacing (ES) | 0.93-1.04 | Inner canthal distance / eye width |
    63→| 15 | Interpupillary Distance (IPD) | 56-70mm | Distance between pupils |
    64→| 16 | Canthal Tilt | 5-8.5 degrees | Angle from inner to outer canthus |
    65→| 17 | Eye Aspect Ratio | 2.8-3.6 | Eye width / eye height |
    66→| 18 | Inner Canthal Distance | 25.5-28% | ICD / bizygomatic width |
    67→| 19 | Outer Canthal Distance | 0.63-0.67 | OCD / bizygomatic width |
    68→| 20 | Medial Canthal Angle | 20-42 degrees | Inner corner angle of eye |
    69→
    70→#### Eyebrow Measurements
    71→
    72→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    73→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    74→| 21 | Eyebrow Tilt | 5-13 degrees | Angle of brow from start to end |
    75→| 22 | Eyebrow Low-Setedness | 0-0.66 | Eye heights above eye line |
    76→| 23 | Brows Height | 0.8-2.0 | Eye height / brow-to-pupil distance |
    77→
    78→#### Nose Measurements (Front)
    79→
    80→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    81→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    82→| 24 | Nasal Width/Height Ratio | 0.62-0.88 | Nose width / nose height |
    83→| 25 | Nose Width/Mouth Width | 1.38-1.53 | Mouth width / nose width |
    84→| 26 | Nose Width/ICD | 0.86-0.94 | Nose width / inner canthal distance |
    85→| 27 | Nose/Zygo Ratio | 0.2-0.3 | Nose width / bizygomatic width |
    86→
    87→#### Lip Measurements
    88→
    89→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    90→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    91→| 28 | Upper/Lower Lip Ratio | 1.4-2.0 | Lower lip height / upper lip height |
    92→| 29 | Ideal Lip Ratio | 1.618 | Golden ratio application |
    93→
    94→#### Chin and Lower Third
    95→
    96→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
    97→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
    98→| 30 | Chin to Philtrum Ratio | 2.0-2.55 | Chin to lip / nose to lip distance |
    99→| 31 | Jaw Frontal Angle | 82-95 degrees | Angle through chin and jaw |
   100→| 32 | Ipsilateral Alar Angle | 84-95 degrees | Angle between nose and outer canthuses |
   101→| 33 | IAA-JFA Deviation | 0-2.5 degrees | Difference between alar and jaw angles |
   102→| 34 | Eye-Mouth-Eye Angle | 47-50 degrees | Angle between mouth center and pupils |
   103→
   104→### 1.2 Side Profile Harmony Measurements
   105→
   106→#### Angular Measurements
   107→
   108→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
   109→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
   110→| 35 | Gonial Angle | 110-130 degrees | Angle at jaw corner (mandible-ramus junction) |
   111→| 36 | Mandibular Plane Angle | 15-25 degrees | Mandible angle relative to Frankfurt plane |
   112→| 37 | Nasofrontal Angle | 106-135 degrees | Angle between forehead and nasal bridge |
   113→| 38 | Nasolabial Angle | 90-105 degrees (M) / 95-110 (F) | Angle between columella and upper lip |
   114→| 39 | Nasomental Angle | 120-132 degrees | Angle from nose to chin |
   115→| 40 | Nasofacial Angle | 30-40 degrees | Nose projection angle from face |
   116→| 41 | Mentolabial Angle | 108-130 degrees | Angle at chin-lip junction |
   117→| 42 | Submental Cervical Angle | 90-110 degrees | Chin to neck angle |
   118→| 43 | Nasal Tip Angle | 112-125 degrees | Angle of nasal tip |
   119→| 44 | Brow Ridge Inclination | 13-24 degrees | Slope of brow ridge |
   120→
   121→#### Convexity Measurements
   122→
   123→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
   124→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
   125→| 45 | Facial Convexity Angle | 165-176 degrees | Profile curvature (glabella-subnasale-pogonion) |
   126→| 46 | Total Facial Convexity | 137.5-148.5 degrees | Overall profile convexity |
   127→
   128→#### Projection Ratios
   129→
   130→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
   131→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
   132→| 47 | Nasal Projection | 0.55-0.68 | Nose projection relative to face |
   133→| 48 | Ramus to Mandible Ratio | 0.59-0.78 (or 5:7) | Vertical jaw height ratio |
   134→| 49 | Cheekbone Position | 81-100% | Cheekbone position on side profile |
   135→| 50 | Orbital Vector | Positive | Eye position relative to cheekbone |
   136→
   137→#### Lip Position (E-Line)
   138→
   139→| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
   140→|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
   141→| 51 | Upper Lip Position | 4mm behind E-line | Upper lip recession |
   142→| 52 | Lower Lip Position | 2mm behind E-line | Lower lip recession |
   143→
   144→#### Structural Relationships
   145→
   146→| # | Measurement | Ideal | Description |
   147→|---|-------------|-------|-------------|
   148→| 53 | Gonion to Mouth Line | Below mouth | Gonion should be below mouth level |
   149→| 54 | Recession (Frankfurt) | None | No recession relative to Frankfurt plane |
   150→| 55 | ANB Angle | 0-4 degrees | Maxilla-mandible skeletal relationship |
   151→
   152→---
   153→
   154→## 2. DIMORPHISM SCORE (20% weight)
   155→
   156→**Definition:** Degree of masculine or feminine sexual characteristics in facial structure.
   157→
   158→### Scale Interpretation
   159→- Score of 0 = Average female features
   160→- Score of 1 = Average male features
   161→- Negative = Hyperfeminine
   162→- Positive > 1 = Hypermasculine
   163→
   164→### Key Dimorphism Features Measured
   165→
   166→| Feature | Masculine Indicators | Feminine Indicators |
   167→|---------|---------------------|---------------------|
   168→| **Brow Ridge** | Prominent bossing, sloped forehead | Smooth, vertical forehead |
   169→| **Supraorbital Projection** | Deep-set eyes, strong projection | Less pronounced |
   170→| **Cheekbones** | Wide, laterally projected | Higher, less wide |
   171→| **Mandible Width** | Broader, wider jaw | Narrower, tapered |
   172→| **Chin** | Square, forward projection | Rounded, narrower |
   173→| **Gonion** | Angular, flared outward | Softer angle |
   174→| **Ramus Height** | Taller (avg 66.5mm male) | Shorter |
   175→| **Nose** | Larger, wider | Smaller, narrower |
   176→| **Lips** | Thinner | Fuller |
   177→| **Lower Face Length** | Longer | Shorter |
   178→
   179→### Specific Dimorphism Measurements
   180→
   181→| # | Measurement | Description |
   182→|---|-------------|-------------|
   183→| 1 | Bizygomatic Width | Highly dimorphic (d = 1.39) - wider in males |
   184→| 2 | fWHR | Mid-face robustness index - larger in males |
   185→| 3 | Glabella Prominence | 2mm more protruding in males |
   186→| 4 | Buccal Fat Volume | Less in masculine faces |
   187→| 5 | Facial Hair Density | Present in males |
   188→| 6 | Ramus Length | Longer in males |
   189→
   190→---
   191→
   192→## 3. ANGULARITY SCORE (15-22% weight)
   193→
   194→**Definition:** Sharpness, definition, and three-dimensionality of facial contours. Heavily influenced by body fat percentage.
   195→
   196→### Optimal Body Fat for Angularity
   197→- Males: 9-12% body fat
   198→- Females: 17-20% body fat
   199→- Cheekbones emerge at: 10-15% (M) / 15-20% (F)
   200→
   201→### Key Angularity Features
   202→
   203→| Feature | High Angularity | Low Angularity |
   204→|---------|-----------------|----------------|
   205→| **Mandible** | Visible, clear contour, flared | Hidden, soft edges |
   206→| **Gonion** | Sharp, defined angle | Rounded, undefined |
   207→| **Cheekbones** | High projection, visible contours | Flat, hidden |
   208→| **Chin** | Defined edges, angular | Rounded, soft |
   209→| **Overall Face** | 3D depth, shadows | Flat, 2D appearance |
   210→| **Jawline** | Sharp, continuous line | Interrupted by fat |
   211→
   212→### Measurement Factors
   213→
   214→| Factor | Impact |
   215→|--------|--------|
   216→| Perimeter-to-Area Ratio | Predicts BMI from face |
   217→| Cheek-to-Jaw Width Ratio | Higher = leaner appearance |
   218→| Lower Face Outline Shape | Angular vs. rounded |
   219→| Mandible Visibility | Definition level |
   220→| Subcutaneous Fat | Less = more angular |
   221→
   222→---
   223→
   224→## 4. FEATURES/MISCELLANEOUS SCORE (25-26% weight)
   225→
   226→**Definition:** Individual feature quality and aesthetics beyond harmony and dimorphism.
   227→
   228→### 4.1 Skin (160 points max)
   229→
   230→| Factor | Description |
   231→|--------|-------------|
   232→| Acne/Blemishes | Absence of active acne |
   233→| Hyperpigmentation | Even skin tone |
   234→| Texture | Smooth, refined pores |
   235→| Scarring | Absence of scars |
   236→| Wrinkles | Skin youthfulness |
   237→
   238→### 4.2 Eyes (231 points max)
   239→
   240→| Factor | Description |
   241→|--------|-------------|
   242→| Eyelid Shape | Hooded vs. exposed |
   243→| Scleral Show | Minimal white showing |
   244→| Upper Eyelid Exposure (UEE) | Optimal coverage |
   245→| Palpebral Fissure Length (PFL) | Eye opening size |
   246→| Eyelash Density | Fuller is better |
   247→| Eyebrow Thickness | Well-defined brows |
   248→| Under-Eye Circles | Absence of darkness |
   249→| Limbal Rings | Visible dark rings around iris |
   250→
   251→### 4.3 Colouring (135 points max)
   252→
   253→| Factor | Description |
   254→|--------|-------------|
   255→| Skin Tone | Healthy coloration |
   256→| Lip Color | Pink, healthy lips |
   257→| Eye Color Contrast | Contrast with skin |
   258→| Hair/Eyebrow Darkness | Well-defined coloring |
   259→| Complexion | Clear, even tone |
   260→
   261→### 4.4 Lower Third (170 points max)
   262→
   263→| Factor | Description |
   264→|--------|-------------|
   265→| Gonion Shape | Angular definition |
   266→| Chin Structure | Projection and shape |
   267→| Ramus Length | Vertical jaw proportion |
   268→| Mandible Symmetry | Left-right balance |
   269→| Jaw Definition | Overall contour |
   270→
   271→### 4.5 Lips (110 points max)
   272→
   273→| Factor | Description |
   274→|--------|-------------|
   275→| Width | Proportional to face |
   276→| Philtrum Length | Distance nose to lip |
   277→| Fullness | Upper and lower lip volume |
   278→| Health | Hydrated, not chapped |
   279→| Commissure Angle | Corner upturn/downturn |
   280→
   281→### 4.6 Nose (110 points max)
   282→
   283→| Factor | Description |
   284→|--------|-------------|
   285→| Alar Width | Should match inner canthi |
   286→| Bulbosity | Tip refinement |
   287→| Tip Definition | Sharp vs. rounded |
   288→| Nostril Show | Minimal visibility from front |
   289→| Dorsum Straightness | Straight vs. humped/scooped |
   290→| Columella Show | 2-3mm ideal on profile |
   291→
   292→### 4.7 Other (115 points max)
   293→
   294→| Factor | Description |
   295→|--------|-------------|
   296→| Ear Pinning | Flat against head |
   297→| Facial Symmetry | Left-right balance |
   298→| Forehead Shape | Proportional, smooth |
   299→| Hairline | Shape and recession |
   300→
   301→---
   302→
   303→## 5. HARMONY vs FEATURES: Key Difference
   304→
   305→| Aspect | Harmony Score | Features Score |
   306→|--------|--------------|----------------|
   307→| **Focus** | Proportions and ratios | Individual feature quality |
   308→| **Measurement** | Mathematical relationships | Aesthetic assessment |
   309→| **Example** | "Eyes are correctly spaced" | "Eyes have good shape and color" |
   310→| **Improvement** | Often requires surgery | Can improve with grooming/skincare |
   311→
   312→---
   313→
   314→## 6. PROFILE-SPECIFIC SCORING
   315→
   316→### Front Profile (61% of harmony points - 307 pts)
   317→
   318→Key measurements weighted by importance:
   319→1. Facial thirds proportion
   320→2. FWHR
   321→3. Eye spacing and canthal tilt
   322→4. Jaw frontal angle
   323→5. Bigonial-bizygomatic ratio
   324→
   325→### Side Profile (39% of harmony points - 196 pts)
   326→
   327→Key measurements weighted by importance:
   328→1. Gonial angle
   329→2. Facial convexity
   330→3. Nasolabial angle
   331→4. Mandibular plane angle
   332→5. Nasal projection
   333→
   334→---
   335→
   336→## 7. OVERALL SCORE CALCULATION
   337→
   338→### Step 1: Normalize Each Category (0-100)
   339→
   340→```
   341→Score = ((Raw - Minimum) / (Maximum - Minimum)) × 100
   342→```
   343→
   344→### Step 2: Apply Weights
   345→
   346→```
   347→Overall = (HARM × 0.32) + (MISC × 0.26) + (ANGU × 0.22) + (DIMO × 0.20)
   348→```
   349→
   350→### Step 3: Apply Harmony Imbalance Penalty
   351→
   352→```
   353→Penalty = (Highest Score - Lowest Score) × 0.5
   354→Final Score = Overall - Penalty
   355→```
   356→
   357→This penalty prevents artificially high scores when one category is strong but others are weak.
   358→
   359→---
   360→
   361→## 8. LOOKSMAXX LABS vs LOOKSMAXX PREMIUM COMPARISON
   362→
   363→| Feature | LOOKSMAXX | Premium Analysis (Gumroad) |
   364→|---------|-------------|-------------------------|
   365→| Measurements | 60+ ratios | 47 cephalometric |
   366→| Scoring | Percentile rankings | Score out of 10 |
   367→| Profiles | Front + Side separate | Combined harmony |
   368→| Ethnicity Adjustment | Yes | Unknown |
   369→| Age/Gender Cohorts | Yes | Unknown |
   370→| Report Length | Interactive dashboard | 50+ page PDF |
   371→| Price | Beta (varies) | ~$25-115 |
   372→
   373→---
   374→
   375→## 9. REFERENCE SOURCES
   376→
   377→### LOOKSMAXX Official
   378→- [LOOKSMAXX](https://www.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app/)
   379→- [Premium Analysis Analysis](https://looksmaxx.gumroad.com/l/full)
   380→- [LOOKSMAXX Beta](https://beta.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app/)
   381→
   382→### Community Research
   383→- [38 Most Important Facial Ratios](https://looksmax.org/threads/38-most-important-facial-ratios-and-the-ideal-measurements-high-effort.956143/)
   384→- [Harmony Calculator](https://looksmax.org/threads/harmony-calculator-including-ideal-ratios-score-sheet.1264955/)
   385→- [2-10 Looks Scale Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/a-2-10-looks-scale-and-a-structured-unbiased-guide-to-facial-analysis-rate-yourself-or-others-with-ease.1723949/)
   386→- [Complete Facial Proportions Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/a-complete-facial-proportions-and-facial-harmony-guide.1599045/)
   387→- [Full Measuring Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/full-measuring-guide.1773516/)
   388→- [All Ideal Ratios for Caucasian Men](https://looksmax.org/threads/all-ideal-ratios-and-angles-for-caucasian-men.552085/)
   389→
   390→### Academic Research
   391→- [Measuring Sexual Dimorphism in Human Faces](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joa.70056)
   392→- [Bizygomatic Width Sexual Dimorphism](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9554718/)
   393→- [Facial Adiposity and Attractiveness](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC6308207/)
   394→- [Ideal Male Jaw Angle Research](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/291384320_The_ideal_male_jaw_angle_-_An_Internet_survey)
   395→
   396→---
   397→
   398→## 10. MEASUREMENT COUNT SUMMARY
   399→
   400→| Category | Front Profile | Side Profile | Total |
   401→|----------|--------------|--------------|-------|
   402→| Harmony Ratios | ~34 | ~21 | ~55 |
   403→| Dimorphism Markers | ~6 | ~4 | ~10 |
   404→| Angularity Factors | ~5 | ~3 | ~8 |
   405→| Feature Assessments | ~25 | ~5 | ~30 |
   406→| **Total Unique Measurements** | ~70 | ~33 | **~60-100** |
   407→
   408→This accounts for the "60+ measurements" claim from LOOKSMAXX and the "47 cephalometric measurements" from Premium Analysis, with the difference coming from how features vs. ratios are counted.
   409→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# LOOKSMAXX Complete Taxonomy of Facial Measurements

This document provides a comprehensive reference of all facial measurements, ratios, and scoring categories used by LOOKSMAXX and similar facial analysis systems.

## Overview

There are two main LOOKSMAXX services:

1. **LOOKSMAXX** (looksmaxx-app.vercel.app / beta.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app) - 60+ facial ratios with percentile rankings
2. **Premium Analysis** (Gumroad) - 47 cephalometric measurements with detailed reports

Both use similar underlying measurement principles but differ in implementation.

---

## Primary Scoring Categories

### Category Weights

| Category | Weight | Description |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| **Harmony (HARM)** | 32-40% | Mathematical proportionality of facial features |
| **Miscellaneous/Features (MISC)** | 25-26% | Individual feature quality and aesthetics |
| **Angularity (ANGU)** | 15-22% | Facial leanness, definition, and 3D projection |
| **Dimorphism (DIMO)** | 20% | Degree of masculine/feminine sexual dimorphism |

---

## 1. HARMONY SCORE (32-40% weight)

**Definition:** Mathematical balance and proportionality of facial features relative to each other.

### 1.1 Front Profile Harmony Measurements

#### Facial Proportions

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 1 | Facial Thirds | 29.5-36.5% each | Upper (hairline-brows), Middle (brows-nose), Lower (nose-chin) |
| 2 | Lower Third Proportion | 30.6-34% | Chin to lower lip relative to nose to upper lip |
| 3 | Total Face Height/Width | 1.3-1.4 | Total facial height divided by bizygomatic width |
| 4 | FWHR | 1.9-2.06 | Bizygomatic width / upper lip to mid-brow height |
| 5 | Total FWHR (tFWHR) | 1.33-1.38 | Bizygomatic width / hairline to chin |
| 6 | Midface Ratio (MFR) | 0.93-1.01 | Upper lip height / IPD line distance |
| 7 | Golden Ratio | 1.6 | Face length / face width |

#### Width Relationships

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 8 | Bigonial/Bizygomatic Width | 85.5-92% | Jaw width relative to cheekbone width |
| 9 | Bitemporal Width | 84-95% | Temple width relative to cheekbone width |
| 10 | Neck Width | 90-100% | Neck width relative to bigonial width |
| 11 | Jaw Width | 0.9-1.0 | Bizygomatic / upper lip line |
| 12 | Cheekbone High-Setedness | 81-100% | Cheekbone position relative to midface height |

#### Eye Measurements

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 13 | Eye Separation Ratio (ESR) | 44.3-47.4% | Pupil distance / bizygomatic width |
| 14 | Eye Spacing (ES) | 0.93-1.04 | Inner canthal distance / eye width |
| 15 | Interpupillary Distance (IPD) | 56-70mm | Distance between pupils |
| 16 | Canthal Tilt | 5-8.5 degrees | Angle from inner to outer canthus |
| 17 | Eye Aspect Ratio | 2.8-3.6 | Eye width / eye height |
| 18 | Inner Canthal Distance | 25.5-28% | ICD / bizygomatic width |
| 19 | Outer Canthal Distance | 0.63-0.67 | OCD / bizygomatic width |
| 20 | Medial Canthal Angle | 20-42 degrees | Inner corner angle of eye |

#### Eyebrow Measurements

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 21 | Eyebrow Tilt | 5-13 degrees | Angle of brow from start to end |
| 22 | Eyebrow Low-Setedness | 0-0.66 | Eye heights above eye line |
| 23 | Brows Height | 0.8-2.0 | Eye height / brow-to-pupil distance |

#### Nose Measurements (Front)

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 24 | Nasal Width/Height Ratio | 0.62-0.88 | Nose width / nose height |
| 25 | Nose Width/Mouth Width | 1.38-1.53 | Mouth width / nose width |
| 26 | Nose Width/ICD | 0.86-0.94 | Nose width / inner canthal distance |
| 27 | Nose/Zygo Ratio | 0.2-0.3 | Nose width / bizygomatic width |

#### Lip Measurements

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 28 | Upper/Lower Lip Ratio | 1.4-2.0 | Lower lip height / upper lip height |
| 29 | Ideal Lip Ratio | 1.618 | Golden ratio application |

#### Chin and Lower Third

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 30 | Chin to Philtrum Ratio | 2.0-2.55 | Chin to lip / nose to lip distance |
| 31 | Jaw Frontal Angle | 82-95 degrees | Angle through chin and jaw |
| 32 | Ipsilateral Alar Angle | 84-95 degrees | Angle between nose and outer canthuses |
| 33 | IAA-JFA Deviation | 0-2.5 degrees | Difference between alar and jaw angles |
| 34 | Eye-Mouth-Eye Angle | 47-50 degrees | Angle between mouth center and pupils |

### 1.2 Side Profile Harmony Measurements

#### Angular Measurements

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 35 | Gonial Angle | 110-130 degrees | Angle at jaw corner (mandible-ramus junction) |
| 36 | Mandibular Plane Angle | 15-25 degrees | Mandible angle relative to Frankfurt plane |
| 37 | Nasofrontal Angle | 106-135 degrees | Angle between forehead and nasal bridge |
| 38 | Nasolabial Angle | 90-105 degrees (M) / 95-110 (F) | Angle between columella and upper lip |
| 39 | Nasomental Angle | 120-132 degrees | Angle from nose to chin |
| 40 | Nasofacial Angle | 30-40 degrees | Nose projection angle from face |
| 41 | Mentolabial Angle | 108-130 degrees | Angle at chin-lip junction |
| 42 | Submental Cervical Angle | 90-110 degrees | Chin to neck angle |
| 43 | Nasal Tip Angle | 112-125 degrees | Angle of nasal tip |
| 44 | Brow Ridge Inclination | 13-24 degrees | Slope of brow ridge |

#### Convexity Measurements

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 45 | Facial Convexity Angle | 165-176 degrees | Profile curvature (glabella-subnasale-pogonion) |
| 46 | Total Facial Convexity | 137.5-148.5 degrees | Overall profile convexity |

#### Projection Ratios

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 47 | Nasal Projection | 0.55-0.68 | Nose projection relative to face |
| 48 | Ramus to Mandible Ratio | 0.59-0.78 (or 5:7) | Vertical jaw height ratio |
| 49 | Cheekbone Position | 81-100% | Cheekbone position on side profile |
| 50 | Orbital Vector | Positive | Eye position relative to cheekbone |

#### Lip Position (E-Line)

| # | Measurement | Ideal Range | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| 51 | Upper Lip Position | 4mm behind E-line | Upper lip recession |
| 52 | Lower Lip Position | 2mm behind E-line | Lower lip recession |

#### Structural Relationships

| # | Measurement | Ideal | Description |
|---|-------------|-------|-------------|
| 53 | Gonion to Mouth Line | Below mouth | Gonion should be below mouth level |
| 54 | Recession (Frankfurt) | None | No recession relative to Frankfurt plane |
| 55 | ANB Angle | 0-4 degrees | Maxilla-mandible skeletal relationship |

---

## 2. DIMORPHISM SCORE (20% weight)

**Definition:** Degree of masculine or feminine sexual characteristics in facial structure.

### Scale Interpretation
- Score of 0 = Average female features
- Score of 1 = Average male features
- Negative = Hyperfeminine
- Positive > 1 = Hypermasculine

### Key Dimorphism Features Measured

| Feature | Masculine Indicators | Feminine Indicators |
|---------|---------------------|---------------------|
| **Brow Ridge** | Prominent bossing, sloped forehead | Smooth, vertical forehead |
| **Supraorbital Projection** | Deep-set eyes, strong projection | Less pronounced |
| **Cheekbones** | Wide, laterally projected | Higher, less wide |
| **Mandible Width** | Broader, wider jaw | Narrower, tapered |
| **Chin** | Square, forward projection | Rounded, narrower |
| **Gonion** | Angular, flared outward | Softer angle |
| **Ramus Height** | Taller (avg 66.5mm male) | Shorter |
| **Nose** | Larger, wider | Smaller, narrower |
| **Lips** | Thinner | Fuller |
| **Lower Face Length** | Longer | Shorter |

### Specific Dimorphism Measurements

| # | Measurement | Description |
|---|-------------|-------------|
| 1 | Bizygomatic Width | Highly dimorphic (d = 1.39) - wider in males |
| 2 | fWHR | Mid-face robustness index - larger in males |
| 3 | Glabella Prominence | 2mm more protruding in males |
| 4 | Buccal Fat Volume | Less in masculine faces |
| 5 | Facial Hair Density | Present in males |
| 6 | Ramus Length | Longer in males |

---

## 3. ANGULARITY SCORE (15-22% weight)

**Definition:** Sharpness, definition, and three-dimensionality of facial contours. Heavily influenced by body fat percentage.

### Optimal Body Fat for Angularity
- Males: 9-12% body fat
- Females: 17-20% body fat
- Cheekbones emerge at: 10-15% (M) / 15-20% (F)

### Key Angularity Features

| Feature | High Angularity | Low Angularity |
|---------|-----------------|----------------|
| **Mandible** | Visible, clear contour, flared | Hidden, soft edges |
| **Gonion** | Sharp, defined angle | Rounded, undefined |
| **Cheekbones** | High projection, visible contours | Flat, hidden |
| **Chin** | Defined edges, angular | Rounded, soft |
| **Overall Face** | 3D depth, shadows | Flat, 2D appearance |
| **Jawline** | Sharp, continuous line | Interrupted by fat |

### Measurement Factors

| Factor | Impact |
|--------|--------|
| Perimeter-to-Area Ratio | Predicts BMI from face |
| Cheek-to-Jaw Width Ratio | Higher = leaner appearance |
| Lower Face Outline Shape | Angular vs. rounded |
| Mandible Visibility | Definition level |
| Subcutaneous Fat | Less = more angular |

---

## 4. FEATURES/MISCELLANEOUS SCORE (25-26% weight)

**Definition:** Individual feature quality and aesthetics beyond harmony and dimorphism.

### 4.1 Skin (160 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Acne/Blemishes | Absence of active acne |
| Hyperpigmentation | Even skin tone |
| Texture | Smooth, refined pores |
| Scarring | Absence of scars |
| Wrinkles | Skin youthfulness |

### 4.2 Eyes (231 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Eyelid Shape | Hooded vs. exposed |
| Scleral Show | Minimal white showing |
| Upper Eyelid Exposure (UEE) | Optimal coverage |
| Palpebral Fissure Length (PFL) | Eye opening size |
| Eyelash Density | Fuller is better |
| Eyebrow Thickness | Well-defined brows |
| Under-Eye Circles | Absence of darkness |
| Limbal Rings | Visible dark rings around iris |

### 4.3 Colouring (135 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Skin Tone | Healthy coloration |
| Lip Color | Pink, healthy lips |
| Eye Color Contrast | Contrast with skin |
| Hair/Eyebrow Darkness | Well-defined coloring |
| Complexion | Clear, even tone |

### 4.4 Lower Third (170 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Gonion Shape | Angular definition |
| Chin Structure | Projection and shape |
| Ramus Length | Vertical jaw proportion |
| Mandible Symmetry | Left-right balance |
| Jaw Definition | Overall contour |

### 4.5 Lips (110 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Width | Proportional to face |
| Philtrum Length | Distance nose to lip |
| Fullness | Upper and lower lip volume |
| Health | Hydrated, not chapped |
| Commissure Angle | Corner upturn/downturn |

### 4.6 Nose (110 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Alar Width | Should match inner canthi |
| Bulbosity | Tip refinement |
| Tip Definition | Sharp vs. rounded |
| Nostril Show | Minimal visibility from front |
| Dorsum Straightness | Straight vs. humped/scooped |
| Columella Show | 2-3mm ideal on profile |

### 4.7 Other (115 points max)

| Factor | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| Ear Pinning | Flat against head |
| Facial Symmetry | Left-right balance |
| Forehead Shape | Proportional, smooth |
| Hairline | Shape and recession |

---

## 5. HARMONY vs FEATURES: Key Difference

| Aspect | Harmony Score | Features Score |
|--------|--------------|----------------|
| **Focus** | Proportions and ratios | Individual feature quality |
| **Measurement** | Mathematical relationships | Aesthetic assessment |
| **Example** | "Eyes are correctly spaced" | "Eyes have good shape and color" |
| **Improvement** | Often requires surgery | Can improve with grooming/skincare |

---

## 6. PROFILE-SPECIFIC SCORING

### Front Profile (61% of harmony points - 307 pts)

Key measurements weighted by importance:
1. Facial thirds proportion
2. FWHR
3. Eye spacing and canthal tilt
4. Jaw frontal angle
5. Bigonial-bizygomatic ratio

### Side Profile (39% of harmony points - 196 pts)

Key measurements weighted by importance:
1. Gonial angle
2. Facial convexity
3. Nasolabial angle
4. Mandibular plane angle
5. Nasal projection

---

## 7. OVERALL SCORE CALCULATION

### Step 1: Normalize Each Category (0-100)

```
Score = ((Raw - Minimum) / (Maximum - Minimum)) × 100
```

### Step 2: Apply Weights

```
Overall = (HARM × 0.32) + (MISC × 0.26) + (ANGU × 0.22) + (DIMO × 0.20)
```

### Step 3: Apply Harmony Imbalance Penalty

```
Penalty = (Highest Score - Lowest Score) × 0.5
Final Score = Overall - Penalty
```

This penalty prevents artificially high scores when one category is strong but others are weak.

---

## 8. LOOKSMAXX LABS vs LOOKSMAXX PREMIUM COMPARISON

| Feature | LOOKSMAXX | Premium Analysis (Gumroad) |
|---------|-------------|-------------------------|
| Measurements | 60+ ratios | 47 cephalometric |
| Scoring | Percentile rankings | Score out of 10 |
| Profiles | Front + Side separate | Combined harmony |
| Ethnicity Adjustment | Yes | Unknown |
| Age/Gender Cohorts | Yes | Unknown |
| Report Length | Interactive dashboard | 50+ page PDF |
| Price | Beta (varies) | ~$25-115 |

---

## 9. REFERENCE SOURCES

### LOOKSMAXX Official
- [LOOKSMAXX](https://www.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app/)
- [Premium Analysis Analysis](https://looksmaxx.gumroad.com/l/full)
- [LOOKSMAXX Beta](https://beta.looksmaxx-app.vercel.app/)

### Community Research
- [38 Most Important Facial Ratios](https://looksmax.org/threads/38-most-important-facial-ratios-and-the-ideal-measurements-high-effort.956143/)
- [Harmony Calculator](https://looksmax.org/threads/harmony-calculator-including-ideal-ratios-score-sheet.1264955/)
- [2-10 Looks Scale Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/a-2-10-looks-scale-and-a-structured-unbiased-guide-to-facial-analysis-rate-yourself-or-others-with-ease.1723949/)
- [Complete Facial Proportions Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/a-complete-facial-proportions-and-facial-harmony-guide.1599045/)
- [Full Measuring Guide](https://looksmax.org/threads/full-measuring-guide.1773516/)
- [All Ideal Ratios for Caucasian Men](https://looksmax.org/threads/all-ideal-ratios-and-angles-for-caucasian-men.552085/)

### Academic Research
- [Measuring Sexual Dimorphism in Human Faces](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/joa.70056)
- [Bizygomatic Width Sexual Dimorphism](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9554718/)
- [Facial Adiposity and Attractiveness](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC6308207/)
- [Ideal Male Jaw Angle Research](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/291384320_The_ideal_male_jaw_angle_-_An_Internet_survey)

---

## 10. MEASUREMENT COUNT SUMMARY

| Category | Front Profile | Side Profile | Total |
|----------|--------------|--------------|-------|
| Harmony Ratios | ~34 | ~21 | ~55 |
| Dimorphism Markers | ~6 | ~4 | ~10 |
| Angularity Factors | ~5 | ~3 | ~8 |
| Feature Assessments | ~25 | ~5 | ~30 |
| **Total Unique Measurements** | ~70 | ~33 | **~60-100** |

This accounts for the "60+ measurements" claim from LOOKSMAXX and the "47 cephalometric measurements" from Premium Analysis, with the difference coming from how features vs. ratios are counted.
